com.googlecode.aluminumproject.utilities.text

Class Splitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.utilities.text.Splitter

  • public class Splitter
extends Object
    Splits text on a number of separators, which are expressed as patterns (regular expressions). Text is scanned from the left to the right; each time a separator is found, a token processor is notified of the token before the separator, the separator itself, and the separator pattern that matches the separator. If multiple separator patterns can match, the longest separator will be chosen. The last token will be offered to the token processor with the empty string as separator and null as separator pattern.

    A character can be escaped to prevent it from being recognised as (part of) a separator. To escape a character, create a splitter with an escape character and put the escape character in front of each character that should be escaped. Another way to prevent tokens to be identified as separators is quoting them. To do so, create a splitter with one or more quotation characters and surround the token text with the quotation characters.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Splitter.QuotationCharacters
      A pair of characters that can be used to prevent a splitter from seeing text as (part of) a separator.
      static interface  Splitter.TokenProcessor
      Will be notified of each token found by a splitter.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Splitter(List<String> separatorPatterns)
      Creates a splitter with a number of separator patterns, but without an escape character or quotation characters.
      Splitter(List<String> separatorPatterns, char escapeCharacter)
      Creates a splitter with a number of separator patterns and an escape character, but without quotation characters.
      Splitter(List<String> separatorPatterns, char escapeCharacter, List<Splitter.QuotationCharacters> quotationCharacters)
      Creates a splitter.
      Splitter(List<String> separatorPatterns, List<Splitter.QuotationCharacters> quotationCharacters)
      Creates a splitter with a number of separator patterns and a number of quotation characters, but without an escape character.

    • Method Detail

      • split

        public void split(String text,
         Splitter.TokenProcessor tokenProcessor)
           throws AluminumException
        Splits text as explained in the class description and notifies a token processor of each token.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to split
        tokenProcessor - the token processor to notify of each token that can be found
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the text to split ends with an escape character, when it contains an unclosed quote character, or when the token processor can't process one of the tokens
